did.abstract: Contains records from the College of General Studies, which was created in 1965 and later became the College of Continuing Studies (and, subsequently, the Division of Continuing Studies). The collection contains reports, meeting minutes, course materials, correspondence, and ephemera.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The College of General Studies was established in 1965 to allow part-time and non-matriculated adult students to take credit and non-credit courses at the University at Albany. It was renamed the College of Continuing Studies in 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include: planning documentation, course schedules and descriptions, annual reports, meeting minutes from the Northeastern New York Committee on Continuing Higher Education, surveys, correspondence, teaching guides, and fliers for courses and workshops.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
